The Human Resources Strategy and Technology degree program is offered at Seneca College. Students in this program are required to complete 36 courses to graduate. Of these 36 courses, 29 are mandatory, 4 are Business electives, and 3 are General Education electives. Some students may be required to take COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) and MATH 1027 (Business Math with Remediation) before progressing to certain courses, but these do not count toward the 36 courses required for graduation and will result in additional charges. Students must complete at least three General Education courses chosen from Social Sciences (GSSC), Arts and Humanities (GHUM), or Science and Technology (GSCI). Students are responsible for making up any failed or dropped courses before graduation, which can be done during the day or through Continuing Education. The following is a list of required courses for the first two semesters:

Semester 1:
- BUS 1038: Business Concepts I (none)
- COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts (none)
- COMP 1010: Business Computer Applications (none)
- HRM 1029: Principles of Human Resource Management I (none)
- MARK 1020: Principles of Marketing I (none)
- MATH 1008: Math for Business & Management I (none)

Semester 2:
- ACCT 1036: Principles of Accounting (none)
- BUS 1040: Project Management (none)
